sense.name: lot
sense.commentary: group, exercise set, circle, band - a group of things that belong together; can refer to people
sense.examples: They were an angry set of fools. The smart set goes there. A set of books was neatly placed in the corner. A set of golf clubs cost him one thousand dollars. She saw a set of dentures placed on a blanket on the sidewalk for sale. He's joined the jet set.

sense.name: positioning
sense.commentary: SET[+event] the act of putting something in position; or something going into position
sense.examples: He gave a final set to his hat. The set of the sun was late today.

sense.name: mindset
sense.commentary: bent - a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way
sense.examples: The set of his mind was obvious.

sense.name: solidification
sense.commentary: hardening, solidifying, curing - the process of becoming hard or solid by cooling or drying or crystallization
sense.examples: The set of concrete takes forever. He tested the set of the glue.

sense.name: TV or radio
sense.commentary: any electronic equipment that receives or transmits radio or tv signals
sense.examples: The early sets ran on storage batteries. Turn off the set if you're not watching it.

sense.name: numbers
sense.commentary: an abstract collection of numbers or symbols
sense.examples: The set of prime numbers is infinite.

sense.name: scenery
sense.commentary: stage - representation consisting of the scenery and other properties used to identify the location of a dramatic production

sense.name: match
sense.commentary: a unit of play in tennis or squash
sense.examples: They played two sets of tennis after dinner.

sense.name: exercise set
sense.commentary: several exercises intended to be done in a series
sense.examples: He did four sets of the incline bench press. Yesterdays, sets were really hard.

sense.name: readiness
sense.commentary: a temporary readiness to respond in a particular way
sense.examples: The subjects' set led them to solve the problems the familiar way and to overlook the simpler solution. His instructions deliberately gave them the wrong set.

sense.name: Set
sense.commentary: Seth - evil beast-headed Egyptian god with high square ears and a long snout
sense.examples: Set was the brother and murderer of Osiris.
